pr_title: Retry behavior for synchronous calls during initialization

timeline.message: Retry behavior for synchronous calls during initialization

timeline.bodyText: What happened if it is a RuntimeException but not an ApiException?  Do we want to limit the number of retries or make it retry forever (hopefully the condition can be resolved)?
timeline.author: jshum2479

replies.bodyText: I'll think about other exceptions... I didn't want to limit the number of retries here because the operator cannot go on until it can connect to the master and the operator will eventually be killed by the liveness probe.
replies.author: rjeberhard

timeline.bodyText: Does the ApiException ever get nested further down?  Is there ever a case where you need to loop through the causes looking for ApiException?
timeline.author: ddsharpe

timeline.bodyText: Please add a comment here that we expect the liveness probe to cancel this process if it "retries forever".  The next coder may not understand the assumption/expectation.
timeline.author: ddsharpe
